ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Study stage
Notes: 0 = Pre-Randomization (TADS) 1 = Stage 1 (TADS) 2 = Stage 2 (TADS) 3 = Stage 3 (TADS) 4 = Stage 4 (TADS) 5 = Stage 5 (SOFTAD); 51=Treatmentas Usual; 52=Screening Alone; 53=Intervention; 67=Unknown; -888=Not Applicable; -999=Missing;

Notes: 1 = AD: Antidepressant; 2 = AA: Anxiolytic; 3 = AP: Antipsychotic; 4 = ST: Stimulan;t 5 = MS: Mood Stabilizer; 6 = OT: Other

How has your mood been? Have you experienced a reasonable sense of cheerfulness or have you felt low spirited and depressed? Since your last appointment, how much of the time have you felt cheerful, contented or sad? How often would you say your moods change? Do they ever last all day? When was the last time you felt that way for a noticeable or extended period of time?
How has your mood been? Explain

Have you felt anxious or worried? If yes  what do you experience? Is this something new? How long does it last? How many times since your last appointment? Does it ever last for more than half a day? If so, when was the last time you felt that anxious or worried?
Have you felt anxious or worried? Explain

Have you had to be admitted to the hospital here or at any other hospital? When?
Have you had to be admitted to the hospital here or at any other hospital? Where?
Have you had to be admitted to the hospital here or at any other hospital? Why?

How do you see the future for yourself? Are you optimistic or pessimistic about your future? Have you felt hopeful or hopeless about your future? If hopeless ask the following: Have you felt like giving up or, is there still a reason you should keep trying?
How do you see the future for yourself? Explain

Since your last visit, have you felt that life wasnt worth the effort? Have you felt like you would be better off if you stopped living? Have you thought about harming yourself or ending it all? If yes, ask the following: What did you think of doing to yourself? Did you do anything that was harmful to yourself? Would you be able to stop yourself from doing something harmful if you felt like that again?
Since your last visit, have you felt that life wasnt worth the effort? Explain

Have you felt like hurting someone else or damaging something? If yes - Have you acted on these feelings? If yes, ask the following: What did you do? Have you felt threatened by anyone or have you threatened anyone since your last visit? Have you been involved in any arguments or fights?
Have you felt like hurting someone else or damaging something? Explain

Current adherence to psychotropic medications- behavior (estimate)
Notes: 1 = Took medication all or almost all of the time; 2 = Took medication much of the time and/or at lower dose than prescribed; 3 = Took medication about half the time; 4 = Took medication sporadically or less than half the time; 5= Did not take medication at all

ElementDescription: Current adherence to psychotropic medications- assistance/support
Notes: 1=None � took medication independently; 2=Received urging, encouragement, or reminders; 3=Received supervision � e.g., medication is administered by someone else; 4=Does not apply � did not take medication

Notes: No event number= No Relapse or Exacerbation Event occurred

ElementDescription: Event Type
Event Number within Event Type
Notes:
S = single event period;
F = first of the event period; C = continuing event period; L = last of event period

ElementDescription: Treatment Status Code
Treatment Group
Notes: 1=Long-Acting Injectable Risperidone Microspheres; 2=Second Generation Oral Antipsychotic Medication

ElementDescription: Days from Visit 1
Numeric Visit Number
Notes: -1.5 = Pre-Screening; -1 = Screening; 0 = Baseline; ## = Visit ## (from 1 to 10); Whole numbers = standard monthly visits; #.001 - #.009 = Unscheduled; #.1 = End of Phase 1; #.2 = End of Phase 2; #.3 = End of Phase 3; #.4 = End of Open Choice Phase; #.5 = End of Study; #.6 = Genetic Analysis; 1000=all visits
